section.name: Mavento - Magento development and deployment with Maven.

subsection.name: Overview
subsection.p:
Mavento is, for the most part, a Maven plugin to build, test and deploy Magento projects. It was started to achieve continous integration for Magento projects, but has since matured into a solid toolbox for Magento developers of all kind. The magento-maven-plugin provides Magento specific goals which can be plugged into the Maven build life cycle or run from any shell. The magento-archetypes provide ready to run Maven projects configured for Magento development.
All projects are open source and can be found on github . For news and questions have a look at twitter.

subsection.name: Why Maven?
subsection.p:
Maven is a software project management and comprehension tool that aims at providing a uniform and easy build process. It is very popular in the Java world, but can handle any type of project, be it java, c++, php, ios, simple static html or even authoring a print book.
Apart from this holistic approach, Maven follows the convention over configuration paradigm, provides excellent dependency management and is designed in an extremly modular fashion. The benefits of Maven get substantial once you have to work/integrate with an increasing number of different projects or as your organisation grows.
Maven is widespread and battle tested, in a recent survey it passed Ant as the most used build tool. As such there is a nice array of plugins available, from managing your source license headers to setting up embedded servers like Selenium or Tomcat.

ul.li: Runs everywhere, not dependent on any unix system tools.
Keep your source files separated from the Magento runtime at all time.
Consistent development environment between all involved devs.
PHP code validation/unit tests via maven-php-plugin. Full support for ecomdev_phpunit or ibuildings_magetest.
Selenium support via maven-selenium-plugin and PHPUnit_Selenium extension.
Flexible automated Magento setup of vanilla or custom instances.
Create snapshots of running Magento instances to be used as base for testing/development.
Less boilerplate Magento code to write with ready to run module templates and code snippets.
Multi module support for bigger projects via reactorbuilds.
Dead easy project integration into CI servers like Jenkins or CQ servers like Sonar.
